text: Tezonco is a station on Line 12 of the Mexico City Metro. The station is located between Periférico Oriente and Olivos. It was opened on 30 October 2012 as a part of the first stretch of Line 12 between Mixcoac and Tláhuac. The station is located southeast of the city center, at the intersection between Avenida Tlahuac and Avenida Benito Juárez, next to the Panteón Civil de San Lorenzo. It is built above the ground. The symbol for the station shows the outline of a calavera, referencing the community's characteristic Day of the Dead celebrations. == References == == External links == * Tezonco Category:Railway stations opened in 2012 Category:2012 establishments in Mexico
title: Tezonco metro station
